title: Coolant Replacement - Filling

body.body: Before starting work, ensure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported. This will help prevent it from falling and causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.

Do not remove the coolant pressure cap when the engine is hot. When the engine is hot, the coolant inside the radiator is hot and also under pressure. Contact with hot coolant will cause scalds and skin damage.
Refit the bottom hose. Ensure the hose clamp is positioned to the alignment mark as noted for removal.
With the aid of an assistant, raise the rear wheel until the filler opening is above the radiator's upper coolant tank.
Slowly add coolant mixture to the system, through the filler opening, until coolant escapes from the filler opening.
If the system has filled correctly and fully, there should be coolant visible through the filler opening.
During filling, squeezing the bottom hose with both hands will help to pump coolant around the system and remove trapped air.
Lower the motorcycle’s rear wheel to the ground.
Reconnect the battery, positive (red) lead first and tighten the battery terminals to
Start the motorcycle and allow the engine to idle. Briefly raise the engine speed several times to allow any air to be expelled from the system.
Stop the engine and allow it to cool.
With the aid of an assistant, raise the fuel tank to allow access to the coolant pressure cap.
If necessary, top up the system through the filler.
